p: Emerging mosquito-borne infectious diseases like Zika, chikungunya, and dengue represent an urgent public health threat that is likely to grow in severity as climate change facilitates host range expansion [ 9]. Population control of the mosquito vectors that transmit these infections remains the main tool for mitigating epidemics. However, the often cryptic and patchily distributed habitat in which these mosquitoes oviposit makes control resource-intensive [ 23] and makes it difficult for all patches in the landscape to participate in surveillance and treatment.
